title: Calories in Apple Cider Donut
meta_description: Discover calories in apple cider donut, including carbs, fat, protein, full nutrition breakdown, and simple tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard medium-sized (about 70 g), fried, coated in cinnamon sugar, made with apple cider flavoring.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, frying method, and toppings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One apple cider donut has about 280 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Glazed topping instead of cinnamon sugar

faqs.q: How many calories in one apple cider donut?
faqs.a: Approximately 280 kcal for a standard fried one.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in an apple cider donut?
faqs.a: About 38 g carbs, including 18 g sugars and 1 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is an apple cider donut high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 13 g total fat, with 6 g saturated.

faqs.q: How does baking affect calories in apple cider donut?
faqs.a: Baking reduces calories by about 80 kcal compared to frying.

faqs.q: What's the protein content of apple cider donut?
faqs.a: Low at 3 g per donut; not a significant protein source.
